confessions.content: I skipped my classes for a week and now I’m terrified I’ll fail mid-terms.
I feel like I don’t belong in my group of friends anymore—they’ve changed and I’m left out.
I’m majoring in business because of the pressure—but I really want to study art instead.
Every time an assignment comes I freeze—my anxiety takes over and I can’t start.
My parents expect me to get a 4.0 GPA but I’m struggling with the workload and burn out.
I volunteered for a club just to look good on my resume but now I dread going there every week.
I don’t connect with any student groups on campus and feel really lonely sometimes.
I keep telling myself I’ll go to the gym tomorrow, but tomorrow never comes.
I’m terrified I’ll never figure out what I want to do with my life after college.
I feel competent in class but as soon as someone asks a question I freeze and my mind goes blank.
